description: From Middle English restles, restelees, from Old English ræstlēas, equivalent to rest +‎ -less.

adjectives.description: restless (comparative more restless, superlative most restless)

examples: The night before his wedding was a restless one.

entries.meaning: Without rest; unable to be still or quiet; uneasy; continually moving.
examples: She sat, restless and nervous, and tried to concentrate.

entries.meaning: Not satisfied to be at rest or in peace; averse to repose; eager for change; discontented.

examples: They remained restless, sitting by the window the entire night.
